titles.title: Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary” / Täʾamrä Mikaʾel “Miracles of Michael” / Täʾamrä Gäbrǝʾel “Miracles of Gabriel” / Täʾamrä Rufaʾel “Miracles of Raphael”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary” (fols. 6ra-105rb) I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah, and hymns (fols. 6ra-12ra) I-2) Introductory exhortation (fols. 12ra-13vb) I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki ʾǝsäggǝd läki ʾǝsäggǝd läki … “I worship Thee…” (fols. 13vb-14vb) I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam: 111 numbered miracles (fols. 14vb-105rb) II) Täʾamrä Mikaʾel “Miracles of Michael”: 1 miracle (fols. 105ra-vb) III) Täʾamrä Gäbrǝʾel “Miracles of Gabriel”: 1 miracle (fols. 105vb-106rb) IV) Täʾamrä Rufaʾel “Miracles of Raphael”: 1 miracle (fols. 106rb-vb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: The name of Śärṣä Śǝllase is written in the main hand (hand a) in the supplication formula on fol. 61rb. The name of Wälättä Yoḥannǝs is crudely written in a recent secondary hand in deep crimson ink in the supplication formulas of Text I: e.g., fols. 14vb, 20rb, 59vb, 73vb, 98va. Names of her relatives are also crudely inserted in a recent secondary hand, in deep crimson ink, in the supplication formulas of Text I: ʾabuyä Gäbrä Tǝnsaʾe (fols. 55ra, 56rb, 59rb), ʾabuyä Gäbrä Mäsqäl (e.g., fols. 56vb, 101vb, 105rb), ʾabuyä Wäl(d)ä Gärima (fols. 57rb, 97rb, 101ra, 102ra), Wälättä Giwärgis (sic) (fols. 99ra, 100rb), ʾuhuyä (sic) Gä(b)rä Ṣadǝq (fol. 47ra). Gäbrä Tǝnsaʾe is written in the main hand (hand b) in the supplication formulas of Texts II-IV: fols. 105ra, 105vb, 106ra, 106rb. The name of ʾabuyä Gäbrä Mäsqäl is written in hand b in the supplication formula of Text II on fol. 105rb.

dcomments.dcomment: Mid-19th – mid-20th cent. Additio 1 is dated 1931 year of mercy (= 1938/39 AD).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. shows traces of intensive use; some leaves are stained with wax and dirt, especially at the beginning and the end of the Ms. (e.g., on fols. 6r, 7r, 104v, 106r). The leather cover is slightly damaged along the corners. Fols. 56 and 59 are undersized. Fol. 19 is cut. Tears amended on many leaves: e.g., fols. 12, 17, 31, 49, 50, 95.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: double circle, triple line fillet, cross hatching, triple sine wave with eye, dice).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of the endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire:
A(4+1; s.l. {5}, no stub/fols. 1r-5v) – I(8/fols. 6r-13v) – II(8/fols. 14r-21v) – III(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 22r-29v) – IV(8/fols. 30r-37v) – ፭V(8/fols. 38r-45v) – VI(8/fols. 46r-53v) – VII(8/fols. 54r-61v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 62r-69v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 70r-77v) – ፲X(8/fols. 78r-85v) – ፲፩XI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 86r-93v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 94r-101v) – XIII(6/fols. 102r-107v).
Fol. 5 is an additional single leaf sewn after quire A.

taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Fol. 106r has one additional bottom ruled line not used by the scribe. The scribe did not use the last 6 lines on fol. 25rb.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 6r-105rb (Text I), Hand b: fols. 105ra-106vb (Texts II-IV).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; elements of the punctuation signs, of the text dividers and of the quire marks; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-1, alternating with black lines; initial two lines of Texts I-3, II, III, IV and subsections of Texts I-1 and I-4; two groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-2, alternating with black lines; two lines of the poems following miracles 4, 6 and 7.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 54rb, 59vb, 70ra, 80vb, 94rb) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fols. 27rb, 49va, 69va, 86va) ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 62ra) ለዓለ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 18ra, 43vb, 65vb, 72ra, 88vb, 98va) ለዓለ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 14vb, 58va, 75rb, 92va) ለዓለ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 16rb, 22vb, 42ra, 63rb, 85va) ለዓለ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 23ra, 57va, 69vb, 103rb, 106vb) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አሜ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fols. 65ra, 100rb) ለዓለ፡ ዓለም፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fols. 26va, 53rb) ለዓለ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fols. 20rb, 30rb) ለዓለመ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 45va, 73vb, 80ra, 96ra) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 18ra, 28ra, 32va, 77ra) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 21rb, 36vb, 44rb, 84ra, 105rb) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለ፡ አን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fols. 56rb, 66va, 84vb, 94rb) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለ፡ አሜ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 31vb) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 34va, 43ra, 51rb, 75vb, 90ra).

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Text I-1 includes the hymns: - Halle luya nǝsäggǝd lä-ʾab bǝrhanat wä-lä-wäldu waḥǝd… “Halleluiah, we worship the Father…” (fols. 9rb-10ra) - ʾƎsäggǝd läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam qǝddǝst dǝngǝl ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali… “I worship you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty…” (fols. 10vb-11ra) - Sälam läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam dǝngǝl ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn ʾǝmmä bǝrhan … “Salutation to you, o my Lady, Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light…” (fols. 11ra-12ra).
All miracles of Mary (Text I-4) are numbered. Miracles 4, 6 and 7 are followed by a poem: - fol. 21ra: ታቦተ፡ አምላከ፡ ፳ኤል፡ ጽዮን፡ ማርያም፡ ዘነገደት፡ ምድረ፡ ኢሎፍሊ። ወቀጥቀጠቶ፡ ለዳጎን፡ ነፍሳተ፡ ብዙኃን፡ ማኅጐሊ፡ አመ፡ ነገደት፡ ቍስቋመ፡ በኃይለ፡ ወልዳ፡ ከሃሊ። ወድቁ፡ አማልክተ፡ ግብጽ፡ መናብርተ፡ ሰይጣን፡ ሀባሊ። ወተኃፍሩ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ዘቦሙ፡ አስጋሊ። - fol. 22vb: እስከ፡ መነነቶ፡ ሚልኮል፡ ቅድመ፡ ታቦተ፡ ሕግ፡ አመ፡ ዘፈነ። ንጉሠ፡ እስራኤል፡ ኪያኪ፡ ዘጸገየ፡ ስነ። ቅድመ፡ ገጸ፡ ሥዕልኪ፡ ድንግል፡ ዘዕዘፍን፡ አነ። ዘይሜንን፡ ተአምረኪ፡ ወሰብሐተ፡ ቍርባነ። በአፈ፡ መላእክት፡ ወሰብእ፡ ለይኩን፡ ምኑነ። (= a strophe from the Maḫletä ṣǝge "Canticle of the Flower", cp. GrohHymn p. 82). - fol. 22vb-23ra: ዛካርያስ፡ ርእየ፡ ለወርኃ፡ ሳባጥ፡ በሠርቁ። ተአምረኪ፡ ለዘይት፡ ማዕከለ፡ ፪አዕፁቁ። ማርያም፡ ጽዮን፡ ለብርሃን፡ ተቅዋመ፡ ወርቁ። ዕዝራኒ፡ በገዳም፡ አመ፡ ወዓለ፡ ውዱቁ። ለኅብረ፡ ገጽኪ፡ ጽጌ፡ ሐተወ፡ መብረቁ። (= a strophe from the Maḫletä ṣǝge "Canticle of the Flower", cp. GrohHymn p. 78). - fol. 25rb (incomplete): ፍቅርኪ፡ አድኃኖ፡ ለበላዒዔ፡ ሰብእ፡ ጊጉይ።

additional.cont: Fol. 107r: Sale note (?).
additional.det: The note is crudely written in pencil and it is barely legible. It is written in Amharic, is dated 1931 year of mercy (= 1938/39 AD) and mentions several individuals: ʾAbrǝha, Giyorgis Wäldä ʾIyäsus, mämḥǝr Wäldä Mikaʾel, Wäldä Gärima. It concludes with ʾAbrǝha’s fingerprint.

extras.extra: - A devotional image of European origin is sewn on fol. 4v. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting: fols. 9rb-10ra. - Omitted letters written interlineally in the main hand: e.g., fols. 15vb, 47va, 70ra, 97rb. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally in small script in a secondary hand: fols. 11va, 12rb. - Omitted letters added at the end of the line in a recent secondary hand in blue pen: fols. 104va, 106ra. - Correction written over erasures in the main hand: fol. 91vb. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 10rb, 14vb, 17va, 35rb. - Erasures marked with thin red lines: fols. 44va, 67rb, 87ra, 94ra. - Lacunae (spaces for rubricated names left unfilled) on many leaves: e.g., fols. 21vb, 26rb, 29vb, 42ra, 70vb, 92vb, 106va.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are written in the main hand in the upper margin: fols. 38r: ፭, 62r: ፰, 70r: ፱, 78r: ፲ (in red ink, undecorated), 86r: ፲፩ (in red ink, undecorated), 94r: ፲፪.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts, written in the main hand in the upper margin: ዘደቅሰዮስ፡ fol. 14vb (in a frame) ዘልደታ፡ fol. 16rb ዘቅዳሴ፡ ቤት፡ fol. 26va (crudely written in a recent secondary hand in blue pen) ዘሕንጸታ፡ ቤት፡ fol. 27rb (crudely written in a recent secondary hand in blue pen).

miniature.details: Fol. 5v: incomplete; legend written in a recent secondary hand in pen: እመ፡ አምላክ፡ “Mother of God”.

frames.frame: - Fol. 6r (incipit page of Text I-1): coloured (strong tangelo, outlined in black) ornamental band; floral and anthropomorphic motifs (one face).
